Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Enjoying the sunset while the waitresses were quick and very nice to talk to. If that couldn't top it of, the quality of the burger was superb and made it all the better. ‚Ä¶

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Tasty burgers and menu as well as drinks and beer. Lovely terrace and good service

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: This caf√© is a pub with lots of delicious beer and snacks. Very rustic atmosphere with a lot of tradition. The service is great and the atmosphere warm.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: A lovely little cafe in the old traditional Dutch style, with a communal atmosphere and warm, familiar service. A well chosen selection of beers and the ubiquitous bitterballen. Views over the canals.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Love this place! We are here for 3 days and after having supper here last night we are coming again tonite! Staff is so friendly - Stan and Bella are lovely young people - food is delicious (get the bitterballen!), beer is cold & delicious from a local brewery, and I love that they bring a heaping bowl of olives to greet you with!

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Friendly local bar, excelent location, beautiful view to the canal. Really tasty food !!! One of the highlights of my trip

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: The historical day arrived - we're allowed to sit outside at a caf√© again! No better place that 't Sluisje. Home made apple pie was good. View excellent. Staff extremely happy & friendly.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Cozy local pub with a great beer selection and food available. The owner was very kind and sweet I would love to come back soon!

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: A lovely little brown cafe in the old traditional Dutch style & very sunny terrace on the both sides of the street. It has existed for more than 100 years and it has a communal atmosphere and warm, familiar service. A well chosen selection ‚Ä¶

Name: 't Sluisje

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Great view in a secluded area. Very cosy. The apple pie is really tasty.

Name: 't Sluisje

Name: 't Sluisje

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Very nice place, cheesy nacho‚Äôs yummy

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Very cost little cafe, both in winter and in summer a really nice place. In summer, because they have a very big terrace and in winter it's nice to stop here for a drink on an urban safari. No matter in which season you visit, service is always friendly!

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Attentive service, always with a smile, quality beers on tap and on bottle, and excellent meals (i recommend runder carpaccio met broodje). Will certainly be coming back when i am in the area and showing friends this beautiful little corner.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: First waitress left a lot to b desired so unhelpful. But the waitress who served us after was great, going out of her way to give1 of our party a choice that wasn't on the menu. Food very good scenery great. Second waitress made the experience worth while.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Nice place for a beer and a snack

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: This cafe is a terrific place that is full of agriculture parts & also many photo's of the local people that are long time ago. The cafe is aswell with foods & good beers & coffee. I will be back again on a sunny day!!

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Poor service, unfriendly and unqualified staff, and an arrogant senior waitress. Real shame for a caf√© in such a serene location.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Great mackerel open sandwich, tasty drink choices & friendly staff. Nice outdoor & indoor seating. Weary cyclists and child friendly although no high chairs.

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Good service, very fast. Beautiful spot. Snacks are generous and tasty.

Name: 't Sluisje

Name: 't Sluisje
Review Text: Unfortunately today I was confronted by racism for the first time in many years by the manager of this establishment. I went for a swim in a public area next to the cafe, my stuff was taken while I was swimming and was held behind the bar. ‚Ä¶

Name: 't Sluisje
